tool.name: Corr.axes
tool.command: mothur_wrapper.py ## output {group_file_name}.pick.{label}.groups {list_file_name}.pick.{label}.list #import re, os.path --cmd='corr.axes' --outputdir='$logfile.extra_files_path' #if $input.source == 'shared': #if isinstance($input.otu.datatype, $__app__.datatypes_registry.get_datatype_by_extension('shared').__class__): --shared="$input.otu" #elif isinstance($input.otu.datatype, $__app__.datatypes_registry.get_datatype_by_extension('relabund').__class__): --relabund="$input.otu" #end if #if $input.label.__str__ != "None" and len($input.label.__str__) > 0: --label="$input.label" #end if #if $input.groups.__str__ != "None" and len($input.groups.__str__) > 0: --groups="$input.groups" #end if #else: --metadata="$input.metadata" #end if --method="$method" --axes="$axes" #if int($numaxes.__str__) > 0: --numaxes="$numaxes" #end if --result='^mothur.\S+\.logfile$:'$logfile,'^\S+\.corr.axes$:'$corr_axes

param.name: otu
param.label: shared or relabund - OTU Shared or Relabund

param.name: metadata
param.label: metadata - Table of floating point values
param.help: metadata has the same number of rows as the samples, but the column(s) are floats that describe the samples (e.g. temperature, weight, etc.)

param.name: method
param.label: method - pearson, spearman, or kendall. Default: pearson

param.name: numaxes
param.label: numaxes - Number of axes to use (default 3)

tool.help:
